meanings.definition: The state or quality of being buggy.
meanings.sent1: The bugginess of the old computer made it frustrating to use.
meanings.sent2: The software developer fixed the bugginess in the program.
meanings.sent3: Despite its bugginess, the antique video game still brought joy to players.
meanings.sent4: The bugginess of the system was like a tangled web of errors.
meanings.sent5: The bugginess of the website was evident in its constant crashes.

meanings.definition: The presence of bugs or glitches in a system or software.
meanings.sent1: We encountered bugginess in the app after the latest update.
meanings.sent2: The IT team worked hard to eliminate the bugginess from the network.
meanings.sent3: The bugginess in the program caused unexpected errors during the presentation.
meanings.sent4: The bugginess of the software was like a hidden maze of problems.
meanings.sent5: Users quickly noticed the bugginess of the new game release.

meanings.definition: The tendency to have bugs or defects.
meanings.sent1: The bugginess of the prototype was a concern for the engineers.
meanings.sent2: Regular updates helped reduce the bugginess of the application.
meanings.sent3: The team joked about the bugginess of their project, calling it 'bug city'.
meanings.sent4: The bugginess of the system was a constant challenge for the developers.
meanings.sent5: The bugginess of the software was a roadblock to its success.
